profiles:
Summary I am a physicist and technologist who loves working in dynamic environments and the cutting edge. I have a multi-disciplinary background in fast paced R&D industry and academic environments. Developed and field tested complex laser optical systems, performed novel atomic physics precision measurements, and developed strong R&D laboratory skills. 
 
Core competency in:  
 
-Technically leading diverse talent 
-Laser & optical systems: Free space optics breadboard prototype to field testing. Laser systems. Beam control and delivery. Photonics and fiber optics. Jitter control. Remote imaging. Precision alignment. Metrology.  
-Quantum physics: Atomic physics, atom interferometry, atomic clocks, spectroscopy, precision measurement.  
-Sensors: Visible, NIR, SWIR, MWIR, and LWIR sensors and optical imaging systems. 
-Hands-on R&D experimentalist: Optical & mechanical design. Metal machining & build prototype. Integration testing & debugging. Electronics, RF systems, and vacuum technology. 
 
Analysis & Design: Matlab, Zeemax, SolidWorks. Summary I am a physicist and technologist who loves working in dynamic environments and the cutting edge. Experience Research Scientist, Sr. Staff Lockheed Martin, Advanced Technology Center (ATC) 2006  – Present (9 years) Palo Alto, CA • Lead technical developer and founding member of the Lockheed Martin ADAM project. ADAM is a disruptive technology product, innovating active tracking & free space laser optical delivery with rapid development and affordable market entry against legacy systems.  
 
o	Chief Scientist and Optical Architect: Responsible for leading multidisciplinary R&D technical teams and field integration & testing from component to system.  
o	Designed and derived requirements for optical, sensor imaging, and beam control systems.  
o	Developed unique technical analysis on: Optical system build & performance, laser propagation, optical tracking controls performance, camera sensor integration & testing, and algorithm & statistical analysis of sensor image feature tracking.  
o	Interfaced and guided design requirements across optical, mechanical engineering, software controls, and system engineering. 
o	Excelled at agility in rapid prototyping, problem solving, and technical leadership in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. 
 
Public information, see: http://www.lockheedmartin.com/adam  
Videos: http://tinyurl.com/ADAM-Rocket, http://tinyurl.com/ADAM-UAV, http://tinyurl.com/ADAM-Boat,  
 
• Developed laser-optical laboratories on: Advanced beam control, laser-material interaction experiments, camera sensor integration & testing, and control system development.  
 
• Optical scientist developing multiple closed loop Shack-Hartmann and self-reference interferometry wavefront sensor adaptive optics system for use with extended scenes and Free Space Optical applications. Associate Research Scientist Stanford University 2004  –  2006  (2 years) Stanford • Designed and built atom interferometer (AI) based inertial sensors integrated with a moving vehicle platform, including photonic and opto-mechanical subassemblies. Technique utilized quantum based atomic interference to measure gravitational gradients of surrounding & remote structures. Thrived in a fast paced dynamic environment requiring novel problem solving and team coordination. 
 
• Technical project management of AI-accelerometer, opto-mechancial, and platform mechanization integration. 
 
• Mentored graduate students and technicians in development, characterization, and troubleshooting of optical, photonic, and sensor design. 
 
• Acquired, analyzed, and presented results to funding agencies: National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA), Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA), and Lockheed Martin Corporation. Postdoctoral Fellow Stanford University 2003  –  2004  (1 year) Research Scientist, Sr. Staff Lockheed Martin, Advanced Technology Center (ATC) 2006  – Present (9 years) Palo Alto, CA • Lead technical developer and founding member of the Lockheed Martin ADAM project. • Demonstrated first-ever novel precision measurement of the Newtonian gravitational constant using quantum based atomic interferometry, featured in Science Magazine. 
 
• Acquired expertise with diode lasers, optics, opto-mechanical, precision RF electronics, sensors and opto-electronic devices. 
 
• Invented and patented a data analysis technique which revolutionized device operation by eliminating the need for active vibration isolation. Experience Senior Scientist Samsung SDS April 2015  – Present (5 months) Shinchun-dong,Songpa-gu, Seoul, SEOUL 138-792 Associate Research Scientist Stanford University October 2011  –  March 2015  (3 years 6 months) San Francisco Bay Area 1. Investigate the cause of human disease using combination of Next Generation Sequencing technology and iPS cell. 
2. Investigate global methyltransferase-substrate network using proteomics approaches; protein microarray and Mass spectrometry. Postdoc Stanford University School of Medicine August 2009  –  September 2011  (2 years 2 months) Protein array based assay development and protein-protein interaction studies Postdoctoral Associate Yale University June 2006  –  July 2009  (3 years 2 months) I work on many aspects of transcription factor interaction between DNAs/RNAs and proteins using protein microarray. 
One of my major goal is to construct TF only microarray using various expression systems. Graduate Student University of Wisconsin-Madison 2000  –  2005  (5 years) I studied transcription regulation and chromatin structure in hematopoetic systems. Specifically, using globin locus as a model I focused on hematopoetic transcription factors and its molecular mechanisms in establishing tissue specific transcription and chromatin structure.
